channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Office Zero-Day Under Active Attack Bypasses Security Features
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Office Zero-Day Under Active Attack Bypasses Security Features

Summary:
Microsoft has issued an emergency out-of-band patch for a high-severity zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft Office, CVE-2026-21509. The flaw, a security feature bypass with a CVSS score of 7.8, is being actively exploited in the wild through malicious documents. It allows attackers to circumvent Object Linking and Embedding (OLE) protections, leading to code execution if a user opens a specially crafted file. The vulnerability affects a wide range of Office products, including Office 2016 through LTSC 2024 and Microsoft 365 Apps. CISA has added the flaw to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating urgent patching for federal agencies and signaling a significant risk to all organizations.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft releases an emergency patch for CVE-2026-21509, a high-severity zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft Office being actively exploited to bypass security features. Learn about the impact and how to mitigate.

Article Slug: microsoft-office-zero-day-cve-2026-21509-actively-exploited

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Critical FortiCloud SSO Flaw Under Active Attack, CISA Issues Urgent Warning
item.description:
Headline: Critical FortiCloud SSO Flaw Under Active Attack, CISA Issues Urgent Warning

Summary:
A critical authentication bypass vulnerability, CVE-2026-24858, in Fortinet's FortiCloud single sign-on (SSO) service is under active exploitation. The flaw allows an attacker with a registered FortiCloud account to gain unauthorized access to devices belonging to other accounts. Fortinet has observed malicious activity, including unauthorized configuration changes and account creation on FortiGate devices. CISA has added the vulnerability to its KEV catalog, urging immediate action. Fortinet temporarily disabled the SSO service to implement mitigations and is working on permanent patches for affected products like FortiOS, FortiManager, and FortiWeb.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Cloud Security

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: An actively exploited critical authentication bypass vulnerability (CVE-2026-24858) in Fortinet's FortiCloud SSO allows attackers to control devices. CISA has issued a warning. Learn the impact and mitigation steps.

Article Slug: fortinet-forticloud-sso-flaw-cve-2026-24858-actively-exploited

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: ShinyHunters Claims Cyberattacks on Bumble, Panera, Match, and Crunchbase
item.description:
Headline: ShinyHunters Claims Cyberattacks on Bumble, Panera, Match, and Crunchbase

Summary:
Several high-profile US companies, including Bumble, Panera Bread, Match Group, and Crunchbase, have been targeted in a series of cyberattacks. A group calling itself 'ShinyHunters' has claimed responsibility, with evidence pointing towards a coordinated social engineering campaign. The impact varies across the companies: Bumble reported a contractor's account was phished, leading to brief network access but no user data compromise. Match Group confirmed a limited amount of user data was affected, while Panera and Crunchbase also reported incidents involving contact information and corporate documents, respectively. The attacks highlight a trend towards leveraging compromised contact data for further malicious activities.

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A wave of cyberattacks claimed by ShinyHunters has hit Bumble, Panera Bread, Match Group, and Crunchbase, stemming from a social engineering campaign. Learn about the impact and how to defend against such threats.

Article Slug: shinyhunters-claims-attacks-on-bumble-panera-match-crunchbase

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Fake Python Spellchecker Packages on PyPI Deploy Remote Access Trojan
item.description:
Headline: Fake Python Spellchecker Packages on PyPI Deploy Remote Access Trojan

Summary:
Two malicious packages, `spellcheckerpy` and `spellcheckpy`, were discovered and removed from the Python Package Index (PyPI). Masquerading as legitimate spell-checking utilities, these packages were downloaded over 1,000 times and were designed to install a full-featured remote access trojan (RAT) on developers' systems. The attacker used a novel technique, hiding a Base64-encoded payload within a Basque language dictionary file (`eu.json.gz`) and activating it only in a later version of the package. This supply chain attack highlights the growing threat of malware in open-source repositories.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers discovered two malicious Python packages on PyPI, 'spellcheckerpy' and 'spellcheckpy', that delivered a remote access trojan (RAT) using a novel hiding technique. Learn about this supply chain attack.

Article Slug: malicious-python-spellchecker-packages-on-pypi-deliver-rat

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Critical 1-Click RCE Flaw in IDIS Cloud Manager Puts Users at Risk
item.description:
Headline: Critical 1-Click RCE Flaw in IDIS Cloud Manager Puts Users at Risk

Summary:
A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-12556, has been discovered in the IDIS Cloud Manager (ICM) viewer by researchers at Claroty's Team82. The flaw, which has a CVSS v4 score of 8.7, allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a user's machine by convincing them to click a specially crafted link. This '1-click RCE' vulnerability bypasses the browser sandbox, making it a potent weapon for spear-phishing campaigns. IDIS has released version 1.7.1 to address the issue and urges users to upgrade or uninstall the software immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Phishing, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Claroty Team82 discovers a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability (CVE-2025-12556) in the IDIS Cloud Manager viewer, allowing attackers to compromise systems with a single click. Update to version 1.7.1 now.

Article Slug: critical-rce-flaw-cve-2025-12556-in-idis-cloud-manager-viewer

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Illinois Department of Human Services Breach Exposes Data of 700,000
item.description:
Headline: Illinois Department of Human Services Breach Exposes Data of 700,000

Summary:
The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) has disclosed a massive data breach that exposed the sensitive records of approximately 700,000 state residents. The incident, one of the largest public-sector breaches of 2026, impacted recipients of various state aid programs. Exposed data for over 672,000 Medicaid and Medicare Savings Program recipients includes addresses, case numbers, and medical plan names. A separate set of 32,000 records belonging to customers of the Division of Rehabilitation Services was also compromised, exposing names, addresses, and case details. The investigation is ongoing to determine the cause and full scope of the breach.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) has confirmed a massive data breach affecting 700,000 people, exposing sensitive PII and PHI from Medicaid and other programs. Learn about the impact of this major public-sector breach.

Article Slug: illinois-dhs-data-breach-exposes-700k-records

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: AI-Fueled Cyberattacks Surge by 70%, Check Point's 2026 Report Reveals
item.description:
Headline: AI-Fueled Cyberattacks Surge by 70%, Check Point's 2026 Report Reveals

Summary:
Check Point's 14th annual Cyber Security Report highlights a dramatic escalation in the global threat landscape, revealing a 70% increase in cyberattacks since 2023. The 2026 report, analyzing trends from 2025, found that organizations faced an average of 1,968 attacks per week. A primary driver of this surge is the weaponization of Artificial Intelligence (AI), which attackers are using to enhance social engineering, accelerate malware development, and automate reconnaissance. The report also notes a shift in ransomware tactics towards data-only extortion and an increase in attacks targeting network edge devices like VPNs and IoT.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Check Point's 2026 Cyber Security Report shows a 70% increase in global cyberattacks, fueled by attackers' use of AI. Learn about the key trends in ransomware, edge device security, and how to adapt your defense strategy.

Article Slug: check-point-2026-cyber-security-report-ai-drives-attack-surge

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Canada's Cyber Security Centre Warns of AI-Fueled Ransomware Evolution
item.description:
Headline: Canada's Cyber Security Centre Warns of AI-Fueled Ransomware Evolution

Summary:
The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security has issued a new 'Ransomware Threat Outlook,' warning that the ransomware threat to Canadian organizations is growing and evolving rapidly. The report highlights that criminals are increasingly leveraging artificial intelligence (AI) to make their attacks more sophisticated, easier to execute, and harder to detect. A key trend identified is the shift towards 'multi-extortion' tactics, where attackers steal data and threaten to leak it in addition to encrypting it. The report stresses that despite the advanced tactics, strong cyber hygiene remains a primary defense.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware, Regulatory

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security's latest report warns that criminals are using AI to fuel more sophisticated ransomware and multi-extortion attacks against Canadian organizations. Learn about the evolving threat.

Article Slug: canadian-cyber-centre-warns-of-ai-fueled-ransomware-threat

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Clop Ransomware Group Claims Attack on Canadian Helicopter Company
item.description:
Headline: Clop Ransomware Group Claims Attack on Canadian Helicopter Company

Summary:
The notorious Clop ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against CMHHELI.COM, a Canadian company. On January 29, 2026, the group added the company to its dark web leak site, threatening to publish stolen data if a ransom is not paid. This incident highlights the persistent and indiscriminate nature of major ransomware gangs, who continue to target organizations of all sizes. Security experts advise victims to initiate incident response, validate backups, and engage professionals before considering any communication with the attackers.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Clop ransomware gang has listed Canadian company CMHHELI.COM as a victim on its data leak site, threatening to release stolen data in a double-extortion attack. Learn about the Clop threat actor and mitigation strategies.

Article Slug: clop-ransomware-claims-attack-on-canadian-company-cmhheli

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Open-Source Malware Skyrockets by 75%, Sonatype's 2026 Report Warns
item.description:
Headline: Open-Source Malware Skyrockets by 75%, Sonatype's 2026 Report Warns

Summary:
Sonatype's 2026 'State of the Software Supply Chain' report reveals an alarming 75% increase in malicious open-source packages, with over 1.233 million identified. The report connects this surge to the rapid adoption of AI and automation in software development, which has accelerated open-source consumption to 9.8 trillion downloads across major registries. This increased velocity expands the attack surface, making it easier for attackers to inject malware into the software supply chain. The report also notes that 86% of traffic from Maven Central, a key Java repository, now comes from automated cloud services, amplifying the risk of widespread compromise from a single malicious package.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence, Malware

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Discover the findings of Sonatype's 2026 State of the Software Supply Chain report, which reveals a 75% increase in open-source malware, driven by AI and automation in software development.

Article Slug: sonatype-2026-report-open-source-malware-surges-75-percent

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Convergence of Identity and Data Security Creates New Attack Vectors, Netwrix Warns
item.description:
Headline: Convergence of Identity and Data Security Creates New Attack Vectors, Netwrix Warns

Summary:
A new report from Netwrix warns that the next wave of cyber threats will arise from the convergence of identity and data security. As organizations increasingly rely on automated workflows to manage data access, attackers are shifting their focus from stealing individual credentials to exploiting misconfigured identity orchestration and automation. The report predicts that failures in identity automation will directly lead to data exposure. With the rise of agentic AI, which can autonomously perform actions, securing the identity of these non-human agents becomes paramount. Netwrix concludes that unified visibility across both identity management and data security is now essential to mitigate these emerging risks.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new report from Netwrix warns that attackers are shifting focus to exploit the convergence of identity and data security, targeting automation and orchestration workflows. Learn about the emerging risks from this trend and AI.

Article Slug: netwrix-report-identity-and-data-security-convergence-threats

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: SoundCloud Breach Exposes Private Emails of 29.8 Million Users
item.description:
Headline: SoundCloud Breach Exposes Private Emails of 29.8 Million Users

Summary:
A significant data breach at the music streaming service SoundCloud has resulted in the public release of a database containing the personal details of 29.8 million users. The data was leaked in January 2026 after the company reportedly refused to pay a ransom demand. The primary risk from this breach stems from the linking of users' private email addresses with their public profile metadata. This combination provides a rich source of data for attackers to launch targeted phishing, credential stuffing, and social engineering campaigns. The breach has been indexed by the notification service HaveIBeenPwned.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A massive data breach at SoundCloud has publicly exposed a database with the private email addresses and profile data of 29.8 million users. Learn about the risks and how affected users can protect themselves.

Article Slug: soundcloud-data-breach-exposes-29-million-users

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of Crunchbase, Betterment via Okta Vishing Attacks
item.description:
Headline: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of Crunchbase, Betterment via Okta Vishing Attacks

Summary:
The notorious cyber extortion syndicate ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for breaching business intelligence firm Crunchbase and financial advisory company Betterment. According to the threat actor, the initial access was gained by using sophisticated voice phishing (vishing) attacks to socially engineer employees and compromise their Okta single sign-on (SSO) credentials. This method allows attackers to bypass weaker forms of multi-factor authentication. Neither of the targeted companies has publicly confirmed the breach.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The ShinyHunters extortion group has claimed responsibility for breaching Crunchbase and Betterment by using voice phishing (vishing) to defeat Okta single sign-on (SSO) security.

Article Slug: shinyhunters-claims-breaches-of-crunchbase-betterment-via-okta-vishing

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 12:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Office Zero-Day (CVE-2026-21509) Under Targeted Attack
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Office Zero-Day (CVE-2026-21509) Under Targeted Attack

Summary:
Microsoft has released an emergency out-of-band security update for CVE-2026-21509, a high-severity security feature bypass vulnerability in Microsoft Office. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 7.8, is being actively exploited in targeted attacks, allowing attackers to bypass Object Linking and Embedding (OLE) protections by tricking users into opening malicious documents. In response to the in-the-wild exploitation, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating federal agencies to apply the patch by February 16, 2026. The update applies to Office 2016, Office 2019, and Office LTSC, while Microsoft 365 Apps customers will receive a service-side update.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Microsoft has released an emergency out-of-band patch for CVE-2026-21509, a critical zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft Office that is being actively exploited. Learn about the flaw, affected systems, and how to mitigate.

Article Slug: microsoft-issues-emergency-patch-for-actively-exploited-office-zero-day

Published Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Fortinet Scrambles to Fix Actively Exploited SSO Auth Bypass (CVE-2026-24858) Hijacking Devices
item.description:
Headline: Fortinet Scrambles to Fix Actively Exploited SSO Auth Bypass (CVE-2026-24858) Hijacking Devices

Summary:
Fortinet has disclosed and patched a critical authentication bypass vulnerability, CVE-2026-24858, in its FortiCloud Single Sign-On (SSO) feature. The flaw is being actively exploited, allowing attackers with a FortiCloud account to log into devices registered to other users, leading to unauthorized configuration changes and account creation. The vulnerability affects a wide range of products, including FortiOS, FortiManager, and FortiAnalyzer. Due to the active exploitation and severity, CISA has added CVE-2026-24858 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, urging users to patch and hunt for signs of compromise immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Fortinet is addressing a critical, actively exploited authentication bypass vulnerability (CVE-2026-24858) in its FortiCloud SSO service. Learn how to detect compromise and apply the necessary mitigations.

Article Slug: fortinet-fixes-actively-exploited-sso-authentication-bypass-flaw

Published Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: SolarWinds Discloses Five Critical RCE & Auth Bypass Flaws in Web Help Desk
item.description:
Headline: SolarWinds Discloses Five Critical RCE & Auth Bypass Flaws in Web Help Desk

Summary:
SolarWinds has disclosed a set of five critical vulnerabilities in its Web Help Desk (WHD) platform, a tool used by over 300,000 organizations. The flaws include two unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities and two authentication bypasses, each with a CVSS score of 9.8. This incident highlights a troubling pattern of recurring patch failures, as one of the new flaws, CVE-2025-40553, is the second bypass of an original deserialization vulnerability (CVE-2024-28986) first patched in 2024. Given the critical nature of the flaws, organizations with internet-facing WHD instances are at extreme risk and must patch immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: SolarWinds has disclosed five critical vulnerabilities in its Web Help Desk (WHD) platform, including RCE and auth bypass flaws with 9.8 CVSS scores. Learn about the risks and the history of failed patches.

Article Slug: solarwinds-discloses-five-critical-flaws-in-web-help-desk-platform

Published Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of 10M Match Group Users from Hinge & OkCupid
item.description:
Headline: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of 10M Match Group Users from Hinge & OkCupid

Summary:
The notorious cybercrime group ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for a major data breach impacting Match Group, the parent company of popular dating apps like Hinge, OkCupid, and Match.com. The group posted on a dark web forum that it has stolen over 10 million user records, and released a 1.7GB sample as proof. The data allegedly includes sensitive user information such as names, phone numbers, IP addresses, and match logs, as well as internal corporate documents. ShinyHunters asserts the data was exfiltrated from a third-party analytics provider, AppsFlyer, highlighting a potential supply chain attack vector.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The ShinyHunters cybercrime group has claimed a major data breach of Match Group, allegedly stealing over 10 million user records from Hinge, OkCupid, and other dating platforms via a third-party vendor.

Article Slug: shinyhunters-claims-massive-data-breach-of-match-group-dating-apps

Published Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Critical RCE Flaws in n8n Workflow Platform Put Thousands of Instances at Risk
item.description:
Headline: Critical RCE Flaws in n8n Workflow Platform Put Thousands of Instances at Risk

Summary:
Two new high-severity vulnerabilities have been discovered in the n8n workflow automation platform, a tool that often holds credentials to critical corporate systems. The most severe flaw, CVE-2026-1470, is a critical eval injection vulnerability (CVSS 9.9) that allows an authenticated attacker to bypass the expression sandbox and achieve full remote code execution. A second flaw, CVE-2026-0863 (CVSS 8.5), allows for a similar sandbox escape in the Python execution environment. A compromise could provide an attacker with a 'skeleton key' to an organization's infrastructure. This news is compounded by data showing over 39,000 n8n instances remain unpatched for a previous critical flaw.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Two high-severity RCE vulnerabilities (CVE-2026-1470, CVE-2026-0863) in the n8n workflow automation platform allow authenticated attackers to bypass sandboxes. Learn about the risks and how to patch.

Article Slug: high-severity-flaws-in-n8n-workflow-platform-allow-rce

Published Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Illinois DHS Data Breach Exposes Sensitive Records of 700,000 People
item.description:
Headline: Illinois DHS Data Breach Exposes Sensitive Records of 700,000 People

Summary:
The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) has confirmed a significant data breach that exposed the sensitive records of approximately 700,000 individuals, making it one of the largest public-sector breaches of 2026. The compromised data includes personal and program-related information for over 672,000 recipients of Medicaid and the Medicare Savings Program. Exposed details include names, addresses, demographic information, and case numbers. The incident highlights the increasing targeting of social service and healthcare agencies by cybercriminals, who use the stolen data for fraud, phishing, and identity theft.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) has confirmed a data breach affecting 700,000 individuals, exposing sensitive data of Medicaid and Medicare program recipients. Learn about the impact and risks.

Article Slug: illinois-human-services-department-breach-exposes-700k-records

item.title: NEW: Malicious PyPI Packages `spellcheckerpy` & `spellcheckpy` Deliver RAT via Hidden Payload
item.description:
Headline: Malicious PyPI Packages `spellcheckerpy` & `spellcheckpy` Deliver RAT via Hidden Payload

Summary:
A software supply chain attack has been uncovered on the Python Package Index (PyPI), involving two malicious packages named `spellcheckerpy` and `spellcheckpy`. Downloaded over 1,000 times, the packages contained a hidden, dormant payload. A later version update activated the malware, which was designed to fingerprint the compromised developer's system and deploy a Remote Access Trojan (RAT). The attack was cleverly concealed, with the malicious code base64-encoded and hidden inside a Basque language dictionary file. The C2 domain used has been linked to a hosting provider known to service nation-state actors, suggesting a potentially sophisticated adversary.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Researchers have discovered two malicious Python packages on PyPI, `spellcheckerpy` and `spellcheckpy`, that deliver a RAT via a hidden, time-delayed payload. Learn how the supply chain attack works.

Article Slug: malicious-python-packages-on-pypi-deliver-rat

Published Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: US Indicts 31 More in ATM Jackpotting Ring Linked to Tren de Aragua Gang
item.description:
Headline: US Indicts 31 More in ATM Jackpotting Ring Linked to Tren de Aragua Gang

Summary:
A U.S. federal grand jury has indicted an additional 31 individuals for their participation in a widespread 'ATM jackpotting' conspiracy, bringing the total number of defendants to 87. The sophisticated scheme involved using malware to force ATMs to dispense large sums of cash. Many of the newly charged individuals are Venezuelan and Colombian nationals, including several identified members of the transnational criminal gang Tren de Aragua (TdA) who are in the U.S. illegally. The case highlights the growing convergence of organized crime and specialized cybercrime tactics.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The U.S. has indicted 31 more individuals, including members of the Tren de Aragua gang, in a large-scale ATM jackpotting conspiracy that used malware to steal millions from banks.

Article Slug: us-indicts-31-more-in-international-atm-jackpotting-scheme

Published Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: EU Proposes Revised Cybersecurity Act to Bolster Supply Chain Security & ENISA's Role
item.description:
Headline: EU Proposes Revised Cybersecurity Act to Bolster Supply Chain Security & ENISA's Role

Summary:
The European Commission has introduced a new cybersecurity package that includes a proposal for a revised Cybersecurity Act (CSA) and targeted amendments to the NIS2 Directive. The initiative aims to strengthen the EU's collective resilience against cyber threats by establishing a framework for ICT supply chain security, promoting 'cyber-secure by design' principles through certification, and enhancing the role of ENISA, the EU's cybersecurity agency. The amendments to NIS2 seek to clarify rules on jurisdiction and streamline ransomware incident data collection. Once adopted, member states will have one year to transpose the new provisions into national law.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: The European Commission has proposed a revised EU Cybersecurity Act and amendments to the NIS2 Directive to strengthen ICT supply chain security, promote 'secure by design', and enhance ENISA's role.

Article Slug: european-commission-proposes-revisions-to-strengthen-eu-cybersecurity-act

Published Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Nova Ransomware Group Claims Cyberattack on KPMG Netherlands, Sets 10-Day Deadline
item.description:
Headline: Nova Ransomware Group Claims Cyberattack on KPMG Netherlands, Sets 10-Day Deadline

Summary:
The Nova ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against the Netherlands division of global professional services firm KPMG. The claim, which appeared on ransomware monitoring services on January 23, 2026, alleges that the group successfully breached KPMG's systems and exfiltrated sensitive data. In a classic double-extortion tactic, the Nova group has reportedly set a ten-day deadline for KPMG Netherlands to enter into ransom negotiations before they potentially leak the stolen data. KPMG has not yet publicly confirmed the attack.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The Nova ransomware group has claimed a cyberattack against KPMG Netherlands, alleging data exfiltration and setting a 10-day ransom deadline. The incident highlights the risk to professional services firms.

Article Slug: nova-ransomware-group-claims-attack-on-kpmg-netherlands

Updated Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: HoneyMyte APT (Mustang Panda) Targets Asian Governments with New Data Stealers and Rootkits
item.description:
Headline: HoneyMyte APT (Mustang Panda) Targets Asian Governments with New Data Stealers and Rootkits

Summary:
The China-aligned advanced persistent threat (APT) group known as HoneyMyte (also tracked as Mustang Panda or Bronze President) has been observed conducting a new espionage campaign targeting government and military organizations in Southeast and East Asia. The campaign features an updated version of the group's 'CoolClient' backdoor, multiple new browser data stealers, and the use of kernel-mode rootkits to achieve stealth and persistence. The group's typical TTPs include spear-phishing and infected USB drives for initial access, followed by DLL side-loading to execute its payloads. The operation is focused on long-term intelligence gathering in geopolitically sensitive regions like Myanmar and Thailand.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: The China-aligned APT group HoneyMyte (Mustang Panda) is targeting government and military entities in Asia with an updated backdoor, new data stealers, and kernel-mode rootkits for enhanced stealth.

Article Slug: honeymyte-apt-group-deploys-advanced-data-stealers-in-new-campaign

Published Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: 'Stanley' MaaS Sells Malicious Chrome Extensions Guaranteed for Web Store Publication
item.description:
Headline: 'Stanley' MaaS Sells Malicious Chrome Extensions Guaranteed for Web Store Publication

Summary:
A new Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) platform named 'Stanley' has appeared on Russian-language cybercrime forums, specializing in the sale of malicious Google Chrome extensions. A key feature of the service is a guarantee that the malicious extensions will be successfully published to the official Chrome Web Store, lending them an air of legitimacy. The primary purpose of these extensions is to facilitate phishing and credential theft by spoofing legitimate websites. The emergence of 'as-a-service' models like Stanley significantly lowers the barrier to entry for less sophisticated cybercriminals to launch effective attacks.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: A new Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) called 'Stanley' has emerged, selling malicious Google Chrome extensions that are guaranteed publication on the official Chrome Web Store to facilitate phishing attacks.

Article Slug: stanley-malware-as-a-service-for-malicious-chrome-extensions-emerges

Published Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: Mustang Panda APT Deploys Signed Kernel-Mode Rootkit to Hide Backdoor
item.description:
Headline: Mustang Panda APT Deploys Signed Kernel-Mode Rootkit to Hide Backdoor

Summary:
The Chinese-linked cyber-espionage group Mustang Panda has significantly upgraded its stealth capabilities by using a signed kernel-mode rootkit to deploy its TONESHELL backdoor. Observed by Kaspersky, the rootkit, named 'ProjectConfiguration.sys', is signed with a leaked digital certificate from a Chinese tech company. By operating at the kernel level as a minifilter driver, the rootkit can effectively hide its malicious processes, files, and registry keys from security software. This new technique allows the group to inject its TONESHELL backdoor directly into the memory of legitimate processes like 'svchost.exe', enhancing its persistence and evasion in attacks targeting government organizations in Southeast Asia.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The Chinese-linked espionage group Mustang Panda is using a signed kernel-mode rootkit ('ProjectConfiguration.sys') to stealthily deploy its TONESHELL backdoor, enhancing its evasion capabilities.

Article Slug: mustang-panda-apt-enhances-stealth-with-signed-kernel-mode-rootkit

item.title: UPDATE: Illinois DHS Exposes Data of 700,000 Residents in Massive Misconfiguration Breach
item.description:
Headline: Illinois DHS Exposes Data of 700,000 Residents in Massive Misconfiguration Breach

Summary:
The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) has disclosed a major data breach affecting approximately 705,000 state residents. The breach was caused by incorrect privacy settings on internal planning maps that were inadvertently made public on a mapping website for up to four years. The exposed data includes addresses, case numbers, and medical plan information for Medicaid recipients, and names, addresses, and case details for customers of the Division of Rehabilitation Services. The exposure, which constitutes a HIPAA violation, was discovered in September 2025 but only announced in January 2026. IDHS has since secured the data and implemented new policies to prevent a recurrence.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) has announced a data breach affecting 700,000 residents due to a misconfigured public mapping website that exposed PII and PHI for several years.

Article Slug: illinois-dhs-data-breach-exposes-700000-residents

item.title: UPDATE: Fortinet Confirms Active Exploitation of FortiCloud SSO Bypass on Fully Patched FortiGate Firewalls
item.description:
Headline: Fortinet Confirms Active Exploitation of FortiCloud SSO Bypass on Fully Patched FortiGate Firewalls

Summary:
Fortinet has confirmed that a critical Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication bypass vulnerability affecting FortiCloud is being actively exploited in the wild. The attacks, linked to CVE-2025-59718 and CVE-2025-59719, are reportedly successful even against fully patched FortiGate firewalls. Attackers are exploiting the flaw by sending specially crafted SAML messages to bypass authentication. Once inside, they are creating persistent administrative accounts, enabling VPN access, and exfiltrating firewall configurations. This allows for long-term persistence and deep network compromise. Customers are urged to review Fortinet's advisories and take immediate mitigation steps.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Fortinet confirms active exploitation of a critical SSO authentication bypass (CVE-2025-59718, CVE-2025-59719) on patched FortiGate firewalls, leading to persistent access and configuration theft.

Article Slug: fortinet-confirms-active-exploitation-of-forticloud-sso-bypass

Published Date: Tue, 27 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT
